data.title: Sunday foorball
data.text: Lots of beer choices, and alcohol. Ordered the Italian nachos. Were good but not great. They have 6 tvs and there were two games on but they only had one game showing. I asked and was told they can only show one at a time. Which not sure why but figured I would let other travelers know. Heard the pizza is tasty but didn't order. Bartender was extremely friendly, and was really the only highlight. Subpar bar atmosphere.

data.title: Delicious Buffet!
data.text: A little pricey but the food is very good.  My kids love the buffet and the games.  For those without kids it is a fun place with lots going on, full bar area, and delicious pizza.

data.title: Noisiest place on earth
data.text: Food ok but forget weekend nights. Even some hip, 20-somethings said they had never heard such bad, screeching, loud music in their lives.  Hard to eat and drink with that going on.

data.title: Great all in repects
data.text: Held a special event here this past summer. The food was excellent, the service super, the staff friendly and helpful and the price extremely reasonable

data.title: Okay, not great
data.text: I went for the Sunday brunch buffet with my husband and our friends. The food is only okay, but the mimosas were good. Pretty bleak selection, especially if you're looking for something light like fruit or yogurt. None to be found. We probably won't be back for the brunch. We have had their pizza, though, and it's very yummy! Especially their specialty ones.

data.title: I love this oven!
data.text: I used to randomly grab lunch here during college at UWEC ... Since the oven is still the same and this was what I enjoyed, I have been back often lately..

data.title: Visited for a Special Event
data.text: I visited this place for a special event. They were a bit understaffed and the seating in the events room was a bit awkward for the event. Only VIP tickets really had a good view of the stage. BUT, the pizzas we ordered were fantastic thus I would definitely go back.

data.title: Terrible staff
data.text: I was a long time customer of Pizza Plus, and I still am a fan of their food; however, they have now lost my interest because of some of their recent hires. The bartenders have recently overcharged me multiple times, refuse to acknowledge their mistake and generally lack professional and courteous communication. Personally, I have never been treated so rudely at any other restaurant; I would strongly recommend finding a different restaurant to dine at.

data.title: Awesome Happy Hour!!!
data.text: Went with friends for happy hour.  1/2 priced taps and some apps.  Great bartender and relaxed atmosphere .

data.title: Seriously Delicious Food!!!!
data.text: Went here twice in 2 days.  Pizza is incredible, drinks are strong.  Loved the artisan rolls and guacamole!   Heavy college crowd so can be noisy, but worth it.  Happy Hour is amazing!

data.title: Great Pizza
data.text: We had  the chicken gorgonzola pizza with caramelized onions and bacon. Really enjoyed the thin crust with the perfect amount of char and crispiness. Very fast and friendly service and neat environment. I really enjoy the recent improvements to the building and rotating selection of entertainment.

data.title: Don't bother
data.text: There really isn't anything good about this place. Horrid service, unpalatable food, in what is essentially a cafeteria in a brick room. Bathrooms are gross. This place is just gross.

data.title: Good Food & Entertainment
data.text: The food has been consistently good at The Plus, with some unique offerings.  The service is average and so are the beer selections.  With such a great local craft beer market, I often wonder why they don't take advantage of that and mix it up a little.  The biggest draw for this stop is the constant entertainment  whether it be live music or a comedian.  Overall, a good place to go!

data.title: Very poor staff issues
data.text:
I'm not sure what happened here, but in one years time, I've completely changed my opinion of The Plus. First of all, not a fan of the new name. I'm sure it's an attempt to sound cool and exclusive in the area, but now you have no idea what the business is and it will only attract locals, not people from outside the area. However, that might not be their biggest issue. 

On two separate occasions in April, I visited The Plus. Once, during brunch and my friend and I were literally yelled at by two staff members for being in their way. The flow of their set up didn't allow room for standing anywhere else. 

When leaving the ladies room, there is a swinging door from the kitchen that staff members come flying through in a huge hurry. They yell, at the top of their lungs, "door!" But don't even wait a millisecond before flying through it. It just feels like a disaster waiting to happen, and no customer should have to deal with this. Also, the ladies room smells horribly of urine. The smell is so bad it literally makes me gag. Positively disgusting. 

On my second visit, this past Thursday evening around 9:30, I ordered a Guiness on tap from the bartender and he told me $5. I paid it thinking it was strange but didn't question it. About 40 minutes later, I ordered another and a drink for my friend (mich golden light) and it was a little over $5 for both. I'm not sure what happened here, but again didn't question it as I was out for a girls night and didn't want to deal with the drama over $3. 

Later in the evening, we needed to meet a friend outside who had never been to the plus and requested to leave our drinks with the bartender in the meantime. We had a strange guy who wouldn't leave us alone and were concerned with unattended drinks. The bartender (same one with the $5 discrepancy) looked at me and nastily said, "you can leave your drink on your table or the rail, just like everyone else does." And went right back to what he was doing. 

After 2 bad experience in one month, I'm hesitant to go to The Plus anytime in the future. Things like my experiences should not ever happen regardless of the experience. Also, keeping your female patrons safe should be your #1 priority. It costs zero effort to put a drink behind the bar. I've never been more upset or disgusted with an establishment in my life after Thursday's debacle.

data.title: Wonderful server and good pizza.
data.text: We went for jazz festival on a Friday night. It was crowded but the server was wonderful. We had a good time and good pizza.

data.title: One of the best places in town.  Need to see.
data.text: Big portions.  Entertainment is great.  Benny the owner is on the ball.  Centrally located with parking all around.

data.title: Yum
data.text: Hadn't been there for years and since it changed ownership and now is called The Plus. Building is same as I remember as a kid, which was nice cause my kids got to enjoy some of the arcade games like I use to. We went at lunch time but just missed the buffet. Ordered pizzas and a salad. Thought it was very yummy. Although my picky eater who's eight did not like the "sand" as he called it on the bottom of the pizza- corn meal I believe it was. The pizza is a thin pizza, I had the margarita. I would definitely go back again. Service was good and friendly.

data.title: Great pizza and drink special
data.text:
They have some nice comedy groups at times.  Pizza is really good with some good drink specials.
Relatively clean and well decored.

data.title: Very good appitizers and comedy shows
data.text: We saw a regional comedian along with a couple of local comedians at this venue. The seating is "iffy" because they perform on a stage but the guests sit at their tables so sometimes the view is blocked. Yet, we enjoyed a very funny show and the appetizers were quite good.

data.title: Great Sunday brunch
data.text: Awesome French toast with Carmel sauce, omelettes to order and a large buffet which includes pizza with thin crispy crust!  Great value!
